availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer. Lee County, Virginia, native. Married to Elizabeth Hyden. Father of Mary Hyden, Nancy Hyden, and Mary J. Hyden. Married to Sophia Hacker Hyden in Clay County, Kentucky, on February 8, 1859. Father of Sarah E. Hyden and John M. Hyden. Merchant in Perry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer Clay County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Clay County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Perry County, District 1, p. 398B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 97.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 350A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Precinct 9, p. 229A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994031, Clay County Marriages.
"Senator John J 'Jack' Hyden (1814-1883)," Find A Grave, Memorial 38585281, accessed January 10, 2024, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38585281.
